bond

Class Bond

  • Object
    • bond.Bond

  • public class Bond
extends Object

    The main entrypoint to Bond, providing static methods to be used for observing the behavior of your program.

    This class uses a builder-style pattern to build up sets of observations which will then be stored. Calling Bond.obs() returns an Observation object which you can then add more observations to. To store all of the observations, call Observation.spy(). Note that you can also call spy() directly on Bond; this will record that that you have spied with no observations. Different variations of spy are available for different expectations about what the spy point may return or throw: spy(String) for a generic Object return type, spy(String, Class) for a type-safe specified return type, spyWithException(String) for throwing Exceptions, and spyWithException(String, Class) for throwing a specific type of checked Exception. All of these methods have counterparts on the Observation object as well. For example:

    
 Bond.obs("key", "value").obs("key2", "value2").spy();
 SpyResult<Object> ret = Bond.obs("key", "value").spy("pointName");
 SpyResult<Integer> ret = Bond.obs("key", "value").spy("pointName", Integer.class);

 try {
   Bond.obs("key", "value").spyWithException("pointName", Exception.class);
 } catch (Exception e) {
   ...
 }

 try {
   Bond.obs("key", "value").spyWithException("pointName", MyCheckedException.class);
 } catch (MyCheckedException e) {
   ...
 }

    The value of an observation can be any object, and will be serialized to JSON using Serializer.

    Upon finishing a test, the current set of observations is compared against a reference set (or, against an emptry string, if no reference set of observations exists). If the current set does not match the reference set, the differences will be reconciled according to the current reconciliation method (set via setReconciliationMethod(ReconcileType), BondTestRule.withReconciliationMethod(ReconcileType), or the BOND_RECONCILE environment variable - see ReconcileType for available types). The accepted set of observations will be saved to a file located in the base observation directory (set via setObservationDirectory(File), BondTestRule.withObservationDirectory(File), or the BOND_OBSERVATION_DIR environment variable), with exact location determined by the name of the test. Any periods in the test name will be translated into a directory hierarchy, and any special (non-alphanumeric) characters will be replaced by underscores. For example, with a test name of "bond.package.MyTest!", the observations will be saved at {observationDirectory}bond/package/MyTest_.json.

      • spy

        public static SpyResult<Object> spy(String spyPointName)
        Spies this point with no observations.
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on.
        Returns:
        The result of the agent deployed for this point, if any, else an absent SpyResult.

      • spy

        public static SpyResult<Object> spy(String spyPointName,
                                    boolean skipSaveObservation)
        Spies this point with no observations.
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on.
        skipSaveObservation - If true, don't actually save the observation; all other relevant SpyAgent actions are still performed. This will be overridden by the skipSaveObservation field of a SpyAgent.
        Returns:
        The result of the agent deployed for this point, if any, else an absent SpyResult.

      • spy

        public static void spy()
        Spies this point with no observation and no name.

      • spy

        public static <T> SpyResult<T> spy(String spyPointName,
                                   Class<T> expectedType)
        Spies this point with no observation, expecting a return type of expectedType. Has no effect and returns an absent SpyResult if isActive() is false.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Same as expectedType.
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on.
        expectedType - Type of value expected to be returned from any active SpyAgent.
        Returns:
        The result of the agent deployed for this point, if any, else an absent SpyResult.
        Throws:
        IllegalSpyAgentException - If the result from the agent matching this spy point does not match expectedType.

      • spy

        public static <T> SpyResult<T> spy(String spyPointName,
                                   Class<T> expectedType,
                                   boolean skipSaveObservation)
        Spies this point with no observation, expecting a return type of expectedType. Has no effect and returns an absent SpyResult if isActive() is false.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Same as expectedType.
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on.
        expectedType - Type of value expected to be returned from any active SpyAgent.
        skipSaveObservation - If true, don't actually save the observation; all other relevant SpyAgent actions are still performed. This will be overridden by the skipSaveObservation field of a SpyAgent.
        Returns:
        The result of the agent deployed for this point, if any, else an absent SpyResult.
        Throws:
        IllegalSpyAgentException - If the result from the agent matching this spy point does not match expectedType.

      • spyWithException

        public static void spyWithException(String spyPointName)
                             throws Exception
        Spies this point with no observation, expecting an Exception to be thrown. Has no effect if isActive() is false.
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on.
        Throws:
        Exception - If an Exception is available on the SpyAgent deployed for this point (if any).
        IllegalSpyAgentException - If the SpyAgent available for this point is not a SpyAgent.SpyAgentWithCheckedException.

      • spyWithException

        public static <E extends Exception> void spyWithException(String spyPointName,
                                                          Class<E> expectedException)
                                                   throws E extends Exception
        Spies this point with no observations, expecting a checked Exception of type expectedException to be thrown. Has no effect if isActive() is false.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Same as expectedException.
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the point being spied on.
        expectedException - Type of Exception expected to be available on any SpyAgent deployed for this point (if any).
        Throws:
        E - If an Exception is available on the SpyAgent deployed for this point (if any).
        IllegalSpyAgentException - If the type of Exception available on the SpyAgent for this point is not compatible with E, or if the agent is not a SpyAgent.SpyAgentWithCheckedException.
        E extends Exception

      • obs

        public static Observation obs(String key,
                              Object value)
        Begin a new spy with the given (key, value) pair as an observation.
        Parameters:
        key - Name for this value.
        value - Value to be observed.
        Returns:
        An Observation object which can be used in a builder-style pattern to construct spy points with more observations.

      • isActive

        public static boolean isActive()
        Used to check if Bond is currently active, which is iff you are currently testing. This can be useful to make some control flow decisions
        Returns:
        True iff Bond is currently active

      • setCurrentTestName

        public static void setCurrentTestName(String name)
        Set the name of the current test. You must already be inside of a test to call this method. The default, if this is not called, is the fully qualified name of the method that is running the current test, e.g. bond.BondTest.testBehavior.
        Parameters:
        name - New name to use for the current test.

      • setObservationDirectory

        public static void setObservationDirectory(File observationDirectory)
        Set the directory which will be used to store test observations. This should generally be within the resources folder of your test folder.
        Parameters:
        observationDirectory - Test observation storage root directory

        Set the way in which Bond should handle reconciliation of tests which do not match their reference observations.
        Parameters:
        reconcileType - Reconciliation method

      • deployAgent

        public static void deployAgent(String spyPointName,
                               SpyAgent agent)
        Deploy a SpyAgent to the given spy point. Whenever spy(java.lang.String) is called with the same spy point name, this agent will be checked to determine if it is applicable (based off of its filters), and if so, the agent's doers, results, and exceptions will be used. Deploying a new agents to a spy point will have the effect of overriding any agents which have been previously deployed to that spy point. If the most recent agent is not applicable to the spy point (due to filters), the next most recent agent is checked for applicability, and so on until an applicable agent is found (or none is found).
        Parameters:
        spyPointName - Name of the spy point to deploy the agent to
        agent - Agent which should be deployed
        See Also:
        SpyAgent
